intro: Solanum schliebenii, commonly known as Schlieben's nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, rounded berries that are toxic to humans. Solanum schliebenii is often found in humid, shaded environments within forests.
